intro: Lagenophora petiolata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters at the base of the leaves. Lagenophora petiolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
